item.title: Summers Before Screens
item.description: Remembering a way of life we’ll never get back

item.title: So Do Judges Get to Read the President’s Mind or Not?
item.description: The president may not be insulated from any judicial review of his motivations.

item.title: A Visit to Winterthur, the House Museum Par Excellence
item.description: The du Pont estate in Delaware might be old-time but the art is timeless.

item.title: Another Harvard Scandal Proves That Science Is Broken
item.description: Harvard’s dishonest expert on honesty is a poignant symbol of a far larger problem in academia: ideological allegiance replacing the quest for truth.

item.title: The Antisemitism Is the Point
item.description: Charges of genocide against Israel are not only disinformation. They are also often projection on the part of its enemies
